h1.span: Governor Newsom Outlines Six Critical Indicators the State will Consider Before Modifying the Stay-at-Home Order and Other COVID-19 Interventions

span.style: font-family: Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 14px;

em.span: VIEW HERE: Governor unveils six key indicators that will be considered before modifying state’s stay-at-home order

span.style: font-family: Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 14px;

p.span: SACRAMENTO – Governor Gavin Newsom today unveiled six key indicators that will guide California’s thinking for when and how to modify the stay-at-home and other orders during the COVID-19 pandemic.

span.style: font-family: Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 14px;

p.span: The Governor noted that the progress in flattening the curve, increased preparedness of our health care delivery system and the effects of other COVID-19 interventions have yielded positive results. However, these actions have also impacted the economy, poverty and overall health care in California. Any consideration of modifying the stay-at-home order must be done using a gradual, science-based and data-driven framework.

span.style: font-family: Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 14px;

p.span: “While Californians have stepped up in a big way to flatten the curve and buy us time to prepare to fight the virus, at some point in the future we will need to modify our stay-at-home order,” said Governor Newsom. “As we contemplate reopening parts of our state, we must be guided by science and data, and we must understand that things will look different than before.”

span.style: font-family: Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 14px;

p.span: Until we build immunity, our actions will be aligned to achieve the following:

ul.style: margin-top: 3px; margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 30px; margin-right: 0px; padding-top: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; padding-right: 0px

li.style: margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; padding-top: 0px; padding-bottom: 3px; padding-left: 0px; padding-right: 0px

span.style: font-family: Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 14px;

li.span: Ensure our ability to care for the sick within our hospitals;

li.style: margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; padding-top: 0px; padding-bottom: 3px; padding-left: 0px; padding-right: 0px

span.style: font-family: Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 14px;

li.span: Prevent infection in people who are at high risk for severe disease;

li.style: margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; padding-top: 0px; padding-bottom: 3px; padding-left: 0px; padding-right: 0px

span.style: font-family: Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 14px;

li.span: Build the capacity to protect the health and well-being of the public; and

li.style: margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; padding-top: 0px; padding-bottom: 3px; padding-left: 0px; padding-right: 0px

span.style: font-family: Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 14px;

li.span: Reduce social, emotional and economic disruptions

span.style: font-family: Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 14px;

p.span: California’s six indicators for modifying the stay-at-home order are:

ul.style: margin-top: 3px; margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 30px; margin-right: 0px; padding-top: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-left: 0px; padding-right: 0px

li.style: margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; padding-top: 0px; padding-bottom: 3px; padding-left: 0px; padding-right: 0px

span.style: font-family: Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 14px;

li.span: The ability to monitor and protect our communities through testing, contact tracing, isolating, and supporting those who are positive or exposed;

li.style: margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; padding-top: 0px; padding-bottom: 3px; padding-left: 0px; padding-right: 0px

span.style: font-family: Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 14px;

li.span: The ability to prevent infection in people who are at risk for more severe COVID-19;

li.style: margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; padding-top: 0px; padding-bottom: 3px; padding-left: 0px; padding-right: 0px

span.style: font-family: Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 14px;

li.span: The ability of the hospital and health systems to handle surges;

li.style: margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; padding-top: 0px; padding-bottom: 3px; padding-left: 0px; padding-right: 0px

span.style: font-family: Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 14px;

li.span: The ability to develop therapeutics to meet the demand;

li.style: margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; padding-top: 0px; padding-bottom: 3px; padding-left: 0px; padding-right: 0px

span.style: font-family: Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 14px;

li.span: The ability for businesses, schools, and child care facilities to support physical distancing; and

li.style: margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; padding-top: 0px; padding-bottom: 3px; padding-left: 0px; padding-right: 0px

span.style: font-family: Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 14px;

li.span: The ability to determine when to reinstitute certain measures, such as the stay-at-home orders, if necessary.

span.style: font-family: Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 14px;

p.span: The Governor said there is not a precise timeline for modifying the stay-at-home order, but that these six indicators will serve as the framework for making that decision.

span.style: font-family: Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 14px;

p.span: He also noted that things will look different as California makes modifications. For example, restaurants will have fewer tables and classrooms will be reconfigured.

span.style: font-family: Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 14px;

p.span: For more information on California’s response, visit covid19.ca.gov.
